description: 共同科英文（二）課程為一學期兩學分課程，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。
goals: 1. 增進學生英語溝通表達能力 2. 透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神 3. 透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野 4. 透過課堂討論培養批判精神 5. 提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣
syllabus:
**FRESHMAN ENGLISH**

                          **Spring, 2019**

**INSTRUCTOR**            Ruei-fang, Shiang (Joyce)

**Course Description**

This course aims to develop student’s English proficiency regarding all 4 language skills. Students are expected to improve their reading and writing (literacy) ability along with listening comprehension and communication competence through a variety of in-class and out-of-class activities.

**Textbook**

**_School- Assigned:_**

Dummet, P. Stephenson, H. & Lansford, L. (2017). _Keynote 3.  National Geographic Learning._

**_Optional, Discipline-related_**: online resources

**Requirements and Rules**

1\. Class attendance, lesson preparation and active class participation are required.

\[\*I’ll take attendance throughout this semester. If you **miss the call for more than twice, you’ll definitely be flunked**. Being late for over 30 minutes is treated as absence for the class that day. If you are absent in case of uncontrollable situations (e.g. illness, emergency, etc.), be sure to ask for leaves **within two weeks** and make sure that I receive the email. Besides, you cannot ask for more than **5** leaves for the whole semester according to the school regulations.\]

**2.Cheating on quizzes or exams** is absolutely forbidden. If someone is found cheating on an exam, he/she will fail that exam.

**3.Textbook** is a must. Violation of this rule will cost you 3 points (out of your final score) each time.

4.Every student must use the multimedia lab **樸****101** for at lease **5 hours** this semester.

5.You are not supposed to use your electronic toys such as laptop, iPad, iPod, or smart phone in class. Violation of this rule will cost you 3 points each time.

**6.Before every meeting**, you are supposed to **preview the vocabulary and the reading**. Quizzes might be given any time to check your attendance & comprehension.

7.The class will be divided into several groups. Each group must choose one reading. Some of the members take the responsibility to **teach the important vocabulary** (giving information about parts of speech, English definition, Chinese translation, and example sentences to show how to use these words and phrases), some take the responsibility to **read aloud** the paragraphs and **ask questions** about them and **provide answers** to the questions, and the others take the responsibility to collect more information about the reading and **give an extensional report** to intrigue the audience and increase their knowledge about the given topic. Your presentation constitutes 10% of your final grade. All the presenters have to upload their materials (ex. ppt, or some questions for Q & A activity) to our course group page in FB **two days before** your presentation.

8.All the English (II) classes have been arranged to take **LEXILE** post-reading test in May and English proficiency test in 17th, March. Please read **LEXILE graded readers** or teacher-assigned short story corresponding to your current **reading level**. All the reading materials can be found in **NTNU library** or downloaded from the Internet**.**

9\. During this semester, you will be required to read many different types

  of reading materials and to work on two, at least, showcase projects.

  The details of these projects will be given in the orientation.

10\. **English Writing Support—**If you have any English writing problems,

    please make appointments with writing tutors:

[http://www.aa.ntnu.edu.tw/8intro/super\_pages.php?ID=6intro73&Sn=238](http://www.aa.ntnu.edu.tw/8intro/super_pages.php?ID=6intro73&Sn=238)

11\. **English Chat Room—** If you want to improve your English speaking

   ability, please be sure to visit English Chat room. It is located at the

   3rd floor of Gongguan Library. No appointment should be made

   online beforehand.

**Grading Policies**

Each student are expected to actively participate in all class activities, group project, etc.. The grading criteria are listed below:

Attendance, participation, and quizzes  15%

Group presentation  16%

Lab visit (at least 5 hours)   5%

Midterm Showcase Project   10%

Participation     44%

3 mins Presentation for Showcase Project    10%

**\* How to succeed in this class:**

(1) Speak English, active participation in group projects and group

   discussion.

(2) Actively express your opinions and ideas.

(3) Be prepared.

**Bonus Points**

1.  Extra hours of using lab may help you earn some bonus points. (at most 5)
2.  Excellent oral presentation in correct English will get extra 5 points at most.

    3.  Participation in any activities held by the English Department, English

          Chat Room will get bonus points.
